<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Sterling Publishing
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sterling Publishing is a leading publisher of non-fiction trade titles. Founded in 1949, Sterling publishes a wide range of non-fiction and illustrated books and kits across a variety of imprints, in
	categories such as health &amp; wellness, music &amp; popular culture, food &amp; wine, crafts &amp; photography, puzzles &amp; games, coloring books and history &amp; current affairs, as well as a large children&#146;s line. Sterling, with a solid
	backlist and robust value publishing program, has a title base of approximately 16,000 eBooks and print books.&nbsp;In addition, Sterling also distributes approximately 1,000 titles on behalf of client publishers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Operations
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The
	Company has seasoned management teams for its retail stores, including those for real estate, merchandising and store operations. Field management includes regional vice presidents and district managers supervising multiple store locations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	12
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage13"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D179245D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Barnes &amp; Noble management team is led by experienced management in both traditional
	product lines and in digital eCommerce. The Barnes &amp; Noble management team employs highly skilled professionals with both media expertise and supply chain management skills. This combination ensures a positive customer experience regardless of a
	customer&#146;s preference for a physical product or a digital one.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Each Barnes &amp; Noble store generally employs a store
	manager, two assistant store managers, two merchandise managers, a caf&eacute; manager, a receiving manager and on average 30 full- and part-time booksellers. Many Barnes &amp; Noble stores also employ a full-time community relations manager. The
	large employee base provides the Company with experienced booksellers to fill new positions in the Company&#146;s Barnes &amp; Noble stores. The Company anticipates that a significant percentage of the personnel required to manage its stores will
	continue to come from within its existing operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Field management for all of the Company&#146;s bookstores, including
	regional vice presidents, district managers and store managers, participate in an incentive program tied to store productivity. The Company believes that the compensation of its field management is competitive with that offered by other specialty
	retailers of comparable size.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Barnes &amp; Noble has in-store training programs providing specific information needed for
	success at each level, beginning with the entry-level positions of bookseller. District managers participate in annual training and merchandising conferences. Store managers are generally responsible for training other booksellers and employees in
	accordance with detailed procedures and guidelines prescribed by the Company utilizing a blended learning approach, including on-the-job training, eLearning, facilitator-led training and training aids available at each bookstore.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Purchasing
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Barnes &amp; Noble&#146;s buyers negotiate costs on select items, marketing funds, promotional discounts, cooperative advertising and
	showroom allowances with publishers and other suppliers for www.barnesandnoble.com and all of the Company&#146;s bookstores. The Company&#146;s distribution centers enable it to maximize available discounts and enhance its ability to create
	marketing programs with many of its vendors. The Company has buyers who specialize in customizing inventory for bookselling in stores and online. Store inventories are further customized by store managers, who may respond to local demand by
	purchasing a limited amount of fast-selling titles through a nationwide wholesaling network, including the Company&#146;s distribution centers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company&#146;s B&amp;N Retail segment purchases physical books on a regular basis from over 500 publishers and nearly 50&nbsp;wholesalers or distributors. Purchases from the top five suppliers
	(including publishers, wholesalers and distributors) accounted for approximately 66% of the B&amp;N Retail&#146;s book purchases during fiscal 2016, and no single supplier accounted for more than 30% of B&amp;N Retail&#146;s book purchases during
	this period. Consistent with industry practice, a substantial majority of the physical book purchases are returnable for full credit, a practice which substantially reduces the Company&#146;s risk of inventory obsolescence.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Publishers periodically offer their excess inventory in the form of remainder books to book retailers and wholesalers through an auction
	process which generally favors booksellers such as the Company, who are able to buy substantial quantities. These books are generally purchased in large quantities at favorable prices and are then sold to consumers at significant discounts off
	publishers&#146; list prices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Distribution
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company has invested significant capital in its systems and technology by building new platforms, implementing new software applications and building and maintaining efficient distribution
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	13
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage14"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D179245D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	centers. This investment has enabled the Company to source a majority of its inventory through its own distribution centers, resulting in direct buying from vendors rather than wholesalers. Using
	the Company&#146;s own distribution centers rather than wholesalers lowers distribution costs per unit, increases inventory turns, and improves product margins. The Company&#146;s distribution centers&#146; 3-prong strategy of (1) accelerating speed
	to market, (2) improving order quality (on-time, complete and damage free) and (3) reducing costs has improved just-in-time deliveries to stores as well as deliveries to the Company&#146;s customers on orders placed via the Barnes &amp; Noble
	website and through the Company&#146;s in-store order network.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of April 30, 2016, the Company has approximately 1,745,000
	square feet of distribution center capacity. The Company has an approximately 1,145,000 square foot distribution center in Monroe Township, New Jersey, which ships merchandise to stores throughout the country and to online customers. The Company
	also has an approximately 600,000 square foot distribution center in Reno, Nevada, which is used to facilitate distribution to stores and online customers in the western United States.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Information Technologies
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company has focused a majority of its
	information technology resources on strategically positioning and implementing systems to support store operations, online technology requirements, merchandising, distribution, marketing and finance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	BookMaster, the Company&#146;s proprietary bookstore inventory management system, integrates point-of-sale features with a proprietary
	data warehouse-based replenishment system. BookMaster enhances communications and real-time access to the Company&#146;s network of bookstores, distribution centers and wholesalers. The Company continues to implement systems to improve efficiencies
	in back office processing in the human resources, finance and merchandising areas.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company plans to continue to invest in
	technologies that will enable it to offer its customers the more convenient and user-friendly online shopping experience. B&amp;N Retail has licensed existing commercial technology when available and has focused its internal development efforts on
	those proprietary systems necessary to provide the highest level of service to its customers. The overall mix of technologies and applications allows the Company to support a distributed, scalable and secure eCommerce environment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company uses Intel
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	&reg;
</SUP>
</FONT>
	-based server technology in a fully redundant configuration to power its current website, which is hosted in two Company-owned locations. Each of these sites has
	sufficient capacity to independently support the volume of traffic directed toward the Company&#146;s website during peak periods. Both hosting locations are configured with redundant power, Internet telecommunications capacity and cooling to
	significantly reduce its exposure to downtime and service outages. Additionally, the Company believes its technology investments are scalable to meet the future growth demands of the business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Competition
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The
	book business is highly competitive in every channel in which Barnes &amp; Noble operates. B&amp;N Retail stores compete primarily on the quality of the shopping and store experience and the price and availability of products. The importance of
	price varies depending on the competitor, with some of Barnes &amp; Noble&#146;s competitors engaging in significant discounting and other promotional activities. B&amp;N
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	14
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage15"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D179245D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Retail competes with other bookstores, including Books-A-Million. It also faces competition from many online businesses, notably Amazon.com and Apple. Increases in consumer spending via the
	Internet may significantly affect its ability to generate sales in B&amp;N Retail stores. B&amp;N Retail also faces competition from mass merchandisers, such as Costco, Target and Wal-Mart. Some of the Company&#146;s competitors have greater
	financial and other resources and different business strategies than B&amp;N Retail does. B&amp;N Retail stores also compete with specialty retail stores that offer books in particular subject areas, independent store operators, variety discounters,
	drug stores, warehouse clubs, mail-order clubs and other retailers offering books, music, toys, games, gifts and other products in its market segments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The music and movie businesses are also highly competitive and the Company faces competition from mass merchants, discounters and electronic distribution. The store experience is geared towards the
	Company&#146;s customer base, including a strong Blu-ray presence as well as a tailored, returnable product assortment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Seasonality
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The B&amp;N Retail business, like that of many retailers, is seasonal, with the major portion of sales and operating
	profit realized during its third fiscal quarter, which includes the holiday selling season.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Employees
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company cultivates a culture of outgoing, helpful and knowledgeable employees. As of April 30, 2016, the B&amp;N Retail segment had
	approximately 28,000 full- and part-time booksellers. The B&amp;N Retail segment&#146;s employees are not represented by unions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	NOOK
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	This segment represents the Company&#146;s digital business, which includes the Company&#146;s
	eBookstore, digital newsstand and sales of NOOK
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	&reg;
</SUP>
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	devices and accessories.&nbsp;The underlying strategy of the NOOK business is to offer customers any digital book,
	newspaper or magazine, anytime, on any device. The Company remains committed to delivering to customers the best digital bookstore experience, providing easy access to Barnes &amp; Noble&#146;s expansive digital collection of over four million
	eBooks, digital magazines and newspapers, while rationalizing its existing cost structure. As part of this commitment, the Company partners with Samsung to develop co-branded NOOK
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	&reg;
</SUP>
</FONT>
	tablets that feature the award-winning Barnes &amp; Noble digital reading experience, while continuing to develop and offer its own black-and-white NOOK
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	&reg;
</SUP>
</FONT>
	eReaders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Barnes&nbsp;&amp; Noble&#146;s NOOK digital bookstore and Reading Apps&#153; provide customers the ability to purchase and read their digital content and access their Lifetime Library on a wide range of
	digital platforms, including&nbsp;Windows 8 PCs and tablets,&nbsp;iPad&#153;, iPhone
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	&reg;
</SUP>
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	, Android&#153; smartphones and tablets, PC and Mac
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	&reg;
</SUP>
</FONT>
	. Barnes&nbsp;&amp; Noble has implemented innovative features on its digital platform to ensure that customers can
	access their NOOK content from almost all of today&#146;s most popular devices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	NOOK currently sells a
	number of different devices to satisfy customers&#146; digital needs, including the Samsung Galaxy Tab
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">

</FONT>
</FONT>

</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	S2 NOOK
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">

	&reg;

	, Samsung Galaxy Tab

	E NOOK

	, Samsung Galaxy Tab

	7.0 device and NOOK GlowLight&#153; Plus. These devices provide customers access to the millions of books and magazines in the NOOK Store, and through Google Play,
	Android apps and games, songs, movies and TV shows, plus popular Google services like the Chrome&#153; browser, Gmail&#153;, YouTube&#153;, Google Search&#153; and Google Maps&#153;.&nbsp;NOOK GlowLight&#153; Plus provides customers a simple, easy
	to use, intuitive eReader on an E&nbsp;Ink display that replicates the experience of reading from physical paper and provides access to the Company&#146;s digital content store. Always Free NOOK Support in any of the B&amp;N Retail bookstores
	provides customers the ability to interact with a knowledgeable bookseller to receive pre- and post- customer sales support. The bookstores also provide free Wi-Fi
</FONT>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D179245D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	connectivity for NOOK
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	&reg;
</SUP>
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	devices, Read In Store&#153; access, which allows owners to read NOOK
	Books&#153; for free. NOOK
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	&reg;
</SUP>
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	devices also allow for digital lending of a wide selection of books through its LendMe
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	&reg;
</SUP>
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	technology.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Operations
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The
	digital products group has knowledgeable product development and operational management teams in the areas of reading software, digital content retailing and mobile device development.&nbsp;Digital product management oversees product concept,
	software development, engineering, and user experience.&nbsp;Operational management has historically overseen demand planning, strategic sourcing, manufacturing, return and refurbishment of hardware. The Company expects that digital product
	management&#146;s role will continue to focus on eReading devices and reading platforms, while also shifting to the management of third-party partner relationships, such as NOOK&#146;s partnership with Samsung proceeds.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On April 7, 2016, the Company entered into an agreement with Bahwan CyberTek (BCT), a global software products and services company, in
	which BCT will take over certain NOOK technology services, including cloud management and development support for NOOK software.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company&#146;s development office employs experienced engineers in the Company&#146;s digital product area. The NOOK digital products management team is currently focused on next generation digital
	reading products to enhance the reading experience and help consumers discover content in new and interesting ways.&nbsp;The Digital Services team, which includes the Cloud and Commerce group, is responsible for maintaining and developing the
	NOOK&#146;s digital bookstore service.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Purchasing/Distribution
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	NOOK acquires the rights to distribute digital content from publishers and distributes the content on
	www.barnesandnoble.com, NOOK
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	&reg;
</SUP>
</FONT>
	devices and other eBookstore platforms.&nbsp;Certain digital content is
	distributed under an agency pricing model, in which the publishers set fixed prices for eBooks and NOOK receives a fixed commission on content sold through the eBookstore.&nbsp;The majority of the Company&#146;s eBooks are sold under the agency
	model.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	NOOK utilizes the Company&#146;s purchasing power and its distribution centers to synergistically facilitate the
	purchasing and shipping of devices and accessories.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Competition
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The eReader and tablet businesses are highly competitive.&nbsp;NOOK competes primarily on price, device functionality, consumer appeal and
	availability of digital content. The importance of price varies depending on the competitor, with some of NOOK&#146;s competitors engaging in significant discounting and other promotional activities. NOOK competes with many online digital
	businesses, notably Amazon.com and Apple. Some of the Company&#146;s competitors have substantially greater financial and other resources and may have different business strategies than NOOK does.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Seasonality
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The
	NOOK business, like that of many technology companies, is impacted by the launch of new products and the promotional efforts to support those new products, as well as the traditional retail holiday selling seasonality.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	16
</FONT>
</P>

	excellent.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company regards its
	trademarks, service marks, copyrights, patents, domain names, trade dress, trade secrets, proprietary technology and similar intellectual property as important to its operations, and it relies on trademark, copyright and patent law, domain name
	regulations, trade secret protection and confidentiality or license agreements to protect its proprietary rights. The Company has registered, or applied for the registration of, a number of domain names, trademarks, service marks, patents, and
	copyrights by U.S. and foreign governmental authorities. Additionally, the Company has filed U.S. and international patent applications covering certain of its proprietary technology. The Company renews its registrations, which vary in duration, as
	it deems appropriate from time to time.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company has licensed in the past, and expects that it may license in the future,
	certain of its proprietary rights to third parties. Some of the Company&#146;s products are designed to include intellectual property licensed or otherwise obtained from third parties. While it may be necessary in the future to seek or renew
	licenses relating to various aspects of the Company&#146;s products and business methods, the Company believes, based upon past experience and industry practice, such licenses generally could be obtained on commercially reasonable terms; however,
	there is no guarantee such licenses could be obtained at all.
</FONT>
</P>

</B>
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company files annual reports on Form 10-K, quarterly reports on Form 10-Q and current reports on Form 8-K, proxy statements and other
	information with the SEC. Any materials filed by the Company with the SEC may be read and copied at the SEC&#146;s Public Reference Room at 100 F Street, NE, Washington, D.C. 20549. Information on the operation of the SEC&#146;s Public Reference
	Room is available by calling the SEC at 1-800-SEC-0330. The SEC maintains a website that contains annual, quarterly and current reports, proxy statements and other information that issuers (including the Company) file electronically with the SEC.
	The Internet address of the SEC&#146;s website is
<I>
	http://www.sec.gov
</I>
	.
</FONT>

	amendment) to either of the above codes, or any waiver of any provision thereof with respect to any of the executive officers, on the Company&#146;s website within four business days following such amendment or waiver.

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_RISK_FACTORS>
<A NAME="FIS_RISK_FACTORS"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<U>
<A NAME="D179245D10K_HTM_TX179245_4">
</A>
	ITEM&nbsp;1A.
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<U>
	Risk Factors
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	The following risk factors and other information included in this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K should be carefully considered. The
	risks and uncertainties described below are not the only ones faced by the Company. Additional risks and uncertainties not presently known or that are currently deemed immaterial also may impair the Company&#146;s business operations. If any of the
	following risks occur, the Company&#146;s business, financial condition, operating results and cash flows could be materially adversely affected.
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Unless otherwise specified or the context otherwise requires, references below to (1)&nbsp;&#147;the Company&#148; refer to Barnes&nbsp;&amp; Noble, Inc. and its subsidiaries, (2)&nbsp;&#147;Retail
	business&#148; refer to the Company&#146;s business included in the Retail segment, and (3) &#147;Digital business&#148; refer to the Company&#146;s business included in the Digital segment, including the sales of digital content, devices and
	accessories.
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	The Company&#146;s businesses are dependent on the overall economic environment and consumer spending patterns.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	A deterioration of the current economic environment could have a material adverse effect on the Company&#146;s
	financial condition and operating results, as well as the Company&#146;s ability to fund its growth or its strategic business initiatives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Retail and Digital businesses&#146; sales are primarily dependent upon discretionary consumer spending, which is affected by the overall economic environment, consumer confidence and other factors
	beyond its control. In addition, the Retail and Digital businesses&#146; sales are dependent in part on the strength of new release products, which are controlled by publishers and other suppliers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Because of the Company&#146;s existing penetration of attractive retail locations and the maturity of the market for traditional retail stores, the
	Company&#146;s sales or net income may decline unless it successfully implements its business strategies.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The
	Company&#146;s primary business is its operation of the Retail business&#146;s stores across the United States, and it derived a majority of its sales from the Retail business&#146;s stores in its most recent fiscal year. Management generally
	believes that the Retail business&#146;s stores are located in attractive geographic markets. Management&#146;s strategies are subject to the risks described herein and elsewhere, and may be subject to other risks that have not yet been identified,
	and management cannot make assurances that its business strategies will be successful.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	The complexity of the Company&#146;s businesses
	could place a significant strain on its management, operations, performance and resources.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The complexity of the
	Company&#146;s businesses could place a significant strain on its management, operations, technical performance, financial resources, and internal financial control and reporting functions.&nbsp;The Company operates two different businesses: the
	Retail business and the Digital business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	18
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage19"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D179245D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	There can be no assurance that the Company will be able to manage the complexity of its businesses effectively. The Company&#146;s current and planned personnel, systems, procedures and controls
	may not be adequate to support and effectively manage its future operations, especially as it employs personnel in multiple geographic locations. The Company may not be able to hire, train, retain, motivate and manage the required personnel, which
	may limit its growth. If any of these were to occur, it could damage the Company&#146;s reputation, limit growth, negatively affect operating results and harm its business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	The Company faces the risk of disruption of supplier relationships and/or supply chain and/or inventory surplus.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The products that the Company sells originate from a wide variety of domestic and international vendors. During fiscal 2016, the Retail business&#146;s five largest suppliers accounted for approximately
	66% of the dollar value of merchandise purchased.&nbsp;While the Company believes that its relationships with its suppliers are strong, suppliers may modify the terms of these relationships due to general economic conditions or otherwise. The
	Company does not have long-term arrangements with most of its suppliers to guarantee availability of merchandise, content, components or services, particular payment terms or the extension of credit limits. If the Company&#146;s current suppliers
	were to stop selling merchandise, content, components or services to it on acceptable terms, including as a result of one or more supplier bankruptcies due to poor economic conditions, the Company may be unable to procure the same merchandise,
	content, components or services from other suppliers in a timely and efficient manner and on acceptable terms, or at all.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In
	addition, certain of our merchandise, including electronic readers, are sourced, directly or indirectly, from outside the United States, including, without limitation, from suppliers in China. Political or financial instability, merchandise quality
	issues, product safety concerns, trade restrictions, work stoppages, tariffs, foreign currency exchange rates, transportation capacity and costs, inflation, civil unrest, natural disasters, outbreaks of pandemics and other factors relating to
	foreign trade are beyond our control and could disrupt our supply of foreign-sourced merchandise and/or adversely affect our results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Furthermore, the Retail business is dependent on the continued supply of trade books. The publishing industry generally has suffered recently due to, among other things, changing consumer preferences away
	from the print medium and the economic climate. A significant disruption in this industry generally could adversely impact the Company&#146;s business. A significant unfavorable change in the Company&#146;s relationships with key suppliers could
	materially adversely affect its sales and profits. In addition, any significant change in the payment terms that the Company has with its key suppliers, including payment terms, return policies, the discount or margin on products or changes to the
	distribution model could adversely affect its financial condition and liquidity. The Company has arrangements with third-party manufacturers with respect to digital devices. These manufacturers procure and assemble unfinished parts and components
	from third-party suppliers based on forecasts provided by the Company. Given production lead times, commitments may be made far in advance of finished product delivery.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	The Company&#146;s relationship with strategic partners could have adverse impacts on the Company and its business.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company relies on third parties to provide certain services for its business. The Company&#146;s business may be adversely impacted if such third parties fail to meet their obligations or to provide
	high levels of service to the Company&#146;s customers.&nbsp;Further, the Company could be subject to claims as a result of the activities, products or services provided by these third-party service providers even though the Company was not directly
	involved in the circumstances leading to those claims.&nbsp;These claims could include, among other things, claims by the Company&#146;s customers and claims relating to data security. Even if these claims do not result in liability to the Company,
	defending and investigating these claims could be expensive and time-consuming, divert personnel and other resources from the Company&#146;s business and result in adverse publicity that could harm the Company&#146;s business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	19
</FONT>

<A NAME="eolPage20"></A>

</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	The Company&#146;s businesses rely on certain key personnel.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Management believes that the Company&#146;s continued success will depend to a significant extent upon the efforts and abilities of
	certain key personnel of the Company. The loss of the services of any of these key personnel could have a material adverse effect on the Company. The Company does not maintain &#147;key man&#148; life insurance on any of its officers or other
	employees.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	The Company&#146;s businesses are seasonal.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For the Company&#146;s Retail business, sales are generally highest in the third fiscal quarter and lowest in the second and fourth fiscal quarters. For fiscal 2016, 34.2% of sales and 135.3% of operating
	income of the Retail business were generated in its third fiscal quarter. Operating results in the Company&#146;s businesses depend significantly upon the holiday selling season in the third fiscal quarter.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Less than satisfactory net sales during the Company&#146;s peak fiscal quarter could have a material adverse effect on its financial
	condition or operating results for the year, and the Company&#146;s results of operations from those quarters may not be sufficient to cover any losses, which may be incurred in the other fiscal quarters of the year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	The Company&#146;s results of operations may fluctuate from quarter to quarter, which could affect the Company&#146;s business, financial condition
	and results of operations.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company&#146;s results of operations may fluctuate from quarter to quarter depending
	upon several factors, some of which are beyond its control. These factors include the timing of new product releases, weather, the level of success of the Company&#146;s product releases, the timing of store openings and closings, shifts in the
	timing of certain promotions and the effect of impairments on the Company&#146;s assets. These and other factors could affect the Company&#146;s business, financial condition and results of operations, and this makes the prediction of the
	Company&#146;s financial results on a quarterly basis difficult. The Company&#146;s quarterly financial results have been and may in the future be below the expectations of public market analysts and investors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	The Company may not be able to adequately protect its intellectual property rights or may be accused of infringing upon intellectual property
	rights of third parties.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company regards its trademarks, service marks, copyrights, patents, trade dress, trade
	secrets, proprietary technology and similar intellectual property as important to its success, and it relies on trademark, copyright and patent law, domain name regulations, trade secret protection and confidentiality or license agreements to
	protect its proprietary rights. Laws and regulations may not adequately protect its trademarks and similar proprietary rights. The Company may be unable to prevent third parties from acquiring domain names that are similar to, infringe upon or
	diminish the value of its trademarks and other proprietary rights.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company may not be able to discover or determine the
	extent of any unauthorized use of its proprietary rights. The protection of the Company&#146;s intellectual property may require the expenditure of significant financial and managerial resources. Moreover, the steps it takes to protect its
	intellectual property may not adequately protect its rights or prevent third parties from infringing or misappropriating its proprietary rights. The Company also cannot be certain that others will not independently develop or otherwise acquire
	equivalent or superior technology or other intellectual property rights.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Other parties also may claim that the Company
	infringes their proprietary rights.&nbsp;Because of the changes in Internet commerce, the electronic reader and digital content business, current extensive patent
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	20
</FONT>
